required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Pharmacokinetic and Safety Profile of Androxal in Male Subjects With Impaired Renal Function
clinical_study.official_title: A Single-Dose, Open-Label Study to Evaluate the Pharmacokinetics and Safety Profile of Androxal in Male Subjects With Impaired Renal Function

brief_summary.textblock:
- To determine and compare the pharmacokinetics (PK) of a single dose of 25 mg Androxal in overweight male subjects with various stages of renal impairment and in volunteers with normal renal function.
- To compare the safety profile of a single dose of 25 mg Androxal in overweight male subjects with various stages of renal impairment and in volunteers with normal renal function.

primary_outcome.description: Pharmacokinetic parameters calculated as a ratio in subjects with mild or moderate renal impairment to normal after a single dose of 25 mg Androxal.

arm_group.description: Healthy males age 18-80 with a body mass index(BMI) 25-42 mg/m^2.
Males with mild renal impairment age 18-80 with a body mass index(BMI) 25-42 mg/m^2 (creatinine clearance 50-80 mL/min).
Males with moderate renal impairment age 18-80 with a body mass index(BMI) 25-42 mg/m^2 (creatinine clearance 30-50 mL/min).
